reviewText:
Early Access Review

Disclaimer - I have been gifted a free key for this game for review purposes, however my review will be kept as truthful as possible, since I am meant to help developers and buyers/gamers.

SCRAPS review

Graphics
SCRAPS has basic graphics which are likely to improve in later development. This means that you don't need  5 processors, 8 fans, 2 PC cases or anything alike to run this game with 60fps or more. I actually like this style of art, it's simplistic and easy, so your computer doesn't get burned down! Anyway, the models are very high res, they're also pretty bad*ss whilest  being made by a developer who knows what he's doing. The SFX are basic, the textures are quite basic (the ground probably has the best texturing in the game) but the game runs just fine. Hopefully you get my point, this game is for gameplay but not for graphics.

Building
There's tons of parts to build from, such as tank cannons to energy generators. Your vehicle will have its own needs, such as head income and outcome, so you'll need to slap a block or few to tackle  them. However, your vehicle has very limited space, even the large category is quite limited. You can even change how high up the suspension is to alter weight! The building is quite in-depth, but content is still lacking. The balance isn't that good at all, I can take sacrificing speed for more cannons, but the other bots always get me from behind ( Í¡Â° ÍœÊ– Í¡Â°) So I can't really kill them without placing a cannon that rotates 360 degrees and hopefully can aim low enough to kill them. But I guess it does make some sense, the Overly Powered builds can be strong going head to head since it's the place of the most firepower, but weak in the back. So I guess it has many challenges waiting to be found out about, you can even make a car that goes 200mph and falls all the time. So this game is fun for the player being able to make crazy builds.. as long as the player has the scrap required (scrap is the game currency to fix, upgrade, or add more parts to a vehicle).

Pros and Cons

Pros:
Very fun game to make random vehicles in
If your car has too much cannons for its weight, it will be kicked back from the cannons once fired
Tons of customisability
Tons of parts
Cheap game
Even a computer with 2 gigabytes or RAM could probably run this gmae on high settings.

Cons:
Basic textures
Dead game with little to no players

Final Ratings
Wolffacritic score: 79/100

Graphics: 6/10

Gameplay: 8.9/10 - So much to do!

Customisability: 7.5/10 - Good amount of content with more to come

I have been gifted the key by the kind developers of the game. They make my review about games like this possible.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Scraps is an awesome physics based vehicle construction game that allows you to create vehicles and battle it out with friends or other people online. The developers gave me early access to the game and I very pleased on the work they have done so far.

The vehicle building in the game is quite fun, there is an endless amount of things you can create, as the building system is not that limiting. I managed to create a huge driveable tower that was so big it went out of my camera range, my buddy also made a driveable dingerdong and named it â™¥â™¥â™¥â™¥ destroyer and so I made a futuristic Star trek portal thing and he stuck his vehicle in mine, it was quite a good time.

This game is unfinished but still at this moment in time it is an awesome game to mess around with friends and have a laugh.

There is also a level based system so that the more you play, you unlock more items to place onto your vehicle. I havnt unlocked everything so I am unsure of this but so far all the weapons are just kinda bland, I am still unure if there is like mortars or some sort of missiles in the game.

Besides that it is worth it!

Gameplay/ First Look:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=IJu6zkbi-Jg

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Note:
Key was provided by developer for testing.

Scraps is like mixture of Twisted Metal and Lego, so yea whats not to like about it.

Now seriously, game has a nice idea and concept. I found very interesting that every little thing you do on your car reflect on its behaviour. So you will have to manage weight balance, energy consumption to steering.

Another cool thing is that there are a lot of unlockables, so you would get after one or two games, new armors, weapons, engines, new parts of all sort.

Things I didnt liked in game, first there are sound effects, I found engine sound after some period of playing is anoying that can easly distract you from enjoying the game.
Second and less important are lack of game mods and maps.

Do not take this as valid cons, since I played game in early access, and found developer very friendly, supportive and helpful.
So I belive that they will try fixing this things I mentioned above.

Overal:
Game is fun and worth trying
My rate at this point with game standing where it is, would be 3/5

Interface is a little dodgy, but it's in early access, so I can expect some weird interfaces and bugs.

Game plays smoothly, and it get's your creative juices flowing for your next server trashing car... Seriously, it happens.

Overall, I very enjoy this game, and my money didn't go to waste for this early access, hope to see more content!

reviewText:
Early Access Review

neinkraft with tanks.

Hello and welcome to Scraps, a project IÂ´m following since a year or two and I actually bought today because I forget everything that comes in my mind in 2 minutes. And compared to its state two years ago, this has actually taken pretty big steps. Only the good parts didnÂ´t change at all, e.g. the gameplay itself.

wot is dis?

This actually is one example of a yet unnamed genre, I call it Build and Fight, call it how you want. So the genre of Robocraft and Homebrew (since they added guns now with the latest update). Gameplay is simple: Build stuff, destroy stuff, collect stuff and repair and build stuff with your collected stuff. ez.

build stuff?

Yes. You get a nice range of parts and then you just build a vehicle out of it. How itÂ´s used and built is up to you, whether you want a lightweight ram with dozens of engines doing 400 km/h or a giant a55 tank with dozens of cannons or something rather normal, depends on your imagination. Building itself is really easy, but also depends on physics.
Remember: Even though you can put enough weapons on your vehicle to eradicate complete europe within seconds, you canÂ´t expect your vehicle to do 150 km/h, like in Robocraft. The limit of how much you can put on your vehicle doesnÂ´t depend on your player rank, but on the servers scrap limit. So, compared to Robocraft, this is balanced very well. Also, you can tune the suspension on your vehicle to edit the handling and center of mass.

range of parts?

You start off with a chassis and a cockpit. You can choose between three chassis yet, a small lightweight one for cheap and light vehicles, a normal one and a big one with enough space for at least 3 million engines and cannons. Then you build on energy generators (because guns need energy to work) and batteries, cooling parts  (because guns get hot while firing), armor to not die the second you get out of the garage, engines, guns and extensions to get more space you need for another 1 million engines.


can i play dis on my potato?

YES YOU CAN. JUST DO IT. (sry)
If you compare this to other games based on Unity, this game has excellent performance and looks fairly nice.

Any cons?

Except having almost no players, not really. This is Early Access, so you canÂ´t expect this to be 100% bug free, but so far In the last year I played the demos of Scraps, I havenÂ´t encountered one bug.

The End?
In my opinion, this is the greatest example of this Build and Fight genre. Robocraft is nice, but these idiotic rank limits and nonexistence of balance are really unnecessary. And to be honest, no one knows how long it will take until Homebrew gets into a well playable state. Buy this. Please. We need players here. For real.


k thx bai.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Release Build Review:
There's not a ton of complexity to the building system (compared to something like Homebrew) but it's fun and lets you build some interesting machines. There will be obvious comparisons between this and Robocraft and TerraTech. I like that you have to harvest scrap and bring it back to a safezone and aren't simply racking up XP with kills.

There's always a balance between the weight of the vehicle, the heat buildup from the weapons, and your power management. I'm hoping we get a more flexible building system in the future (right now everything is stacked upon 2 chassis). I want more freedom to make bizarre little vehicles that push the limits of plausibility and physics.

I put a video overview up on my youtube channel for those interested. (I can't link directly to it because Steam is hilariously censoring the link due to the random letters youtube generated for the link)
https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLMV7bfY2SzbX9AmjpTGpu66aGgbvnP_hV

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Scraps by developer Moment Studios takes the vehicle â€˜build it and destroy itâ€™ mechanics to the main stream masses. Scraps has a post-apocalyptic feel, with  anarchy and violence ruling the barren wasteland and roaming bands of marauders hell bent on killing each other for the few remaining salvageable parts left behind. Game play consist of blowing your opponents apart before they do the same to you. The landscape consist of flat and hilly terrain with evacuation zones randomly thrown in where you can hobble your damaged vehicle in for repairs and upgrades. Currently, there are only a handful of maps to play on so things can get repetitive once youâ€™ve played on them over and over again.

The assortment of blocks, chassis and weapons you can place on your vehicle is pretty staggering. Itâ€™s almost as if the Hells Angels, Mad Max and the local car clubs were selling parts at a garage sale; itâ€™s an impressive assortment and youâ€™ll have a field day picking and choosing the right parts. Once youâ€™ve assembled your vehicle of mayhem, itâ€™s time to hit the battlefield to pulverize your opponents. The name of this game is Scraps but the game is all about total destruction.

Scraps is certainly a fun little gem. Probably not as fun as being 5 years old and launching hot wheels cars at your cousinâ€™s dollhouse, but fun in an adult sort of way. Some might say, Yeah
date: but Scraps gameplay isnâ€™t a new and itâ€™s not the first." Well
recommended: it doesnâ€™t have to reinvent anything â€“ it just needs to improve on the old formula. Scraps might not be the first vehicle combat game out of the gate
hoursPlayed: but itâ€™s currently the best one out there.\n"

reviewText:
Early Access Review

As far as actual gameplay, it is a simple concept. Build an awesome car, and destroy other cars with it. Very much like twisted metal games, except you actually get to build a car you want, you can make it a lightweight gunner or perhaps your style is more of a heavy tank? Or maybe you change up depending on what other players are running? I mean it is pretty much open for you.

After continually to play this game after release I have to say, I do find this game enjoyable

Yes, there is plenty of room for improvement, and the however it is totally worth it. The developer is committed to making this game worth it.

It is fun, and it is also something that is fun to play with friends over LAN (Plenty of smack talk involved).

Minor issues include the repair feature not actually replacing lost modules, it just repairs the ones that are on it. So it can be hard to continue a streak of you not dying, because it can be hard to get enough scrap to repair and replace the parts on your buggy.

I have been playing this game somewhat before its release, since I did back it on the kickstarter, and I am still confused at how the weapon grouping works with the button.

As far as actual gameplay, it is a simple concept. Build an awesome car, and destroy other cars with it. Very much like twisted metal games, except you actually get to build a car you want, you can make it a lightweight gunner or perhaps your style is more of a heavy tank? Or maybe you change up depending on what other players are running? I mean it is pretty much open for you.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I had been following this game for a while via the old tech demos but had never been willing to pull the trigger on purchasing the game since the demos lacked any real form of game play.  With something playable finally released, I decided to give it a go.  Unfortunately, the actual game play mechanics are awful.

Despite being a car combat game with a focus on building your dream deathmobile and watching it get destroyed in actual combat, trying to actually build a fun car is tedious.  The actual vehicle construction is fine -- however, the developer decided to hide half the parts under a Call of Duty unlock system.  Great, another game to grind away at before I can even do anything.  Another issue is the game's money and cost system.  To put it simply, in combat, you are supposed to start with a basic car and acquire money to purchase bigger and better cars, all of which can be your personal designs.  The way money is acquired, however, is horrendous, requiring players to deposit money on pads" -- a process that requires you to sit in park for three seconds with a giant bullseye on your head -- as opposed to just letting you keep any earned money in a manner similar to Counter-Strike.  Also
date: destroyed cars cost money for them to be replaced
recommended: meaning that one lost vehicle is all it takes to set you back to square one.  Players basically wind up in an infinite loop of never having enough money to actually do anything once combat begins.\n\nThe actual combat itself is lousy.  The only vehicle design that really matters is how many massive cannons are strapped to your car; speed is moot since the terrains are so mountainous you can barely drive four feet without rolling over.  The game provides little feedback as to when you've been hit; your car gets "hit" and it is nearly impossible to tell where your vehicle is suffering the most damage until half your car has simply been pulverised.  Did I mention that every time a part breaks off your car
hoursPlayed: your vehicle will bounce?  This basically turns every encounter into a whoever-shoots-first-wins affair.\n\nDespite being in development since 2013
voteText: the game is still little beyond a tech demo with a basic AI
helpfulPercent: little in terms of actual game play
votesHelpful: and costs thirteen dollars to boot.  I do not recommend this product."

reviewText:
Early Access Review

Tl; Dr: Honestly the worst game I have ever played.


Look, I really wanted to give a positive review for this game, I really did. I've been following it even before it came on steam greenlight, and was really excited to get my hands on this game. Too bad it was aweful. Even on a 35% off sale this wasn't worth it. Not when you have games such as Robocraft (free to play), and terra tech that blow this one out of the water. And look, I know it's in early access and that it might have potential one day, but the concept is crappy at best, the multiplayer servers are laggy as hell (if you can even find an opponent), and the single-player AI (even on the hardest difficulty) is a blundering pile of sh*t. Please, please, if you have even the slightest scrap (see what i did) of self respect, DO NOT BUY THIS GAME!!!

P.S. I got a refund, but i still had to pay international transfer fees from my bank, so it was a complete waste of f*cking time and resources

reviewText:
Early Access Review

got a free game code from pc gamer mag

Basically this game could be fun for me, and i wish it was, but the problem is all i wanted to do was start the game and play with loads of cool guns and rocket launchers, and i couldnt, so... :(

from the get go there are 5 guns you can stick on your car...thing, at least when you start the game, there is a leveling system so something more interesting may be available later, but i cant be bothered to grind for it, i mean i dont even know if i am grinding to anything.

The asking price is Â£10, i would not pay that much for this game in its current state, i would much rather play a game such as robocraft, which is free btw.

Its early access so more content will come, but at the date of writing this review there is not enough to make this game worth my time, and i dont think it is worth your money either.

Oh and the music is actually quite cool though :D

I honestly feel like this could be a really fun competitive game if everything is done right.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

I looked over everything, watched a couple videos on youtube, read reviews (should have listened to the negative ones instead of the positive ones ), and played the demo. I have also played car shooting games before, I'm not great at them, but I'm also not horrible at them.

So, I build a car, and start a game against 3 easy AI players. About the best I did was manage a couple of times to pick up scrap, left over from me blowing up, and rush to the evac. Then I used most of it to make repairs, because of all the damage I got on the way.

Next I thought maybe if I just have 2 AI players maybe it will be easier. I also got the large cannons unlocked after destroying some boxes on the test track, so I thought maybe I can out gun them. Started the game they had the large cannons too, so that didn't work, and I died even faster than the first game.

My idea of easy is not dying every 30 seconds, nor is that my idea of fun, and my idea of advancing in a game isn't staying on the test track blowing up boxes. So I requested a refund, and hope I get it.

reviewText:
Early Access Review

the game is fun although has highly annoying features. These features being,
ridicuouls gun kickback
stupidly long grind sessions for xp and unlocking new parts
my least favorite the fact that certian items are 2 wwide on a 3 wide car (you cant line things up)
and finally, the spawns can put you on top of a fight and instantly be killed if someone has a large cannon.

I have a feeling these are easy fixes and i would like to see them fixed.
Even though the game has bad features there are many great features. Some of these great features are
really good physics system
smart AI
well balanced fighting (if you aim at the generator you can cause way more damage than if you just aim at the cockpit)

I hope this game gets a lot of good recognition and i really want some people to play with online.
